bwwExcerpt: Miss Saigon has been criticized among some experts to be one of those British mega-musicals that's low on substance and high on production values. Sure, a massive helicopter appears on stage in the impressively immersive Act II flashback scene in this tour (and here, I must give kudos to set designers Totie Driver and Matt Kinley, projection designer Luke Hall, sound designer Mick Potter, and lighting designer Bruno Poet for creating such a cohesive, audiovisual experience).
